verses.roman:
prasāda khāya, 'hari' bale sarva-bhakta-jana
dekhi' haridāsa-rūpera haraṣita mana

synonyms: prasāda khāya—eat the prasāda; hari bale—chant the holy name of Hari; sarva-bhakta-jana—all the devotees; dekhi'-seeing this; hari-dāsa—of Haridāsa Ṭhākura; rūpera—and of Rūpa Gosvāmī; haraṣita—jubilant; mana—the minds.
translation: When Haridāsa Ṭhākura and Rūpa Gosvāmī saw that all the devotees were accepting prasāda and chanting the holy name of Hari, they both were greatly pleased.
